SENT.plain: In Morocco, thromboangiitis obliterans (TAO) is the most common cause of obliterating arteriopathy in subjects under 40 years: 252 cases out of 291, versus 21 cases of diabetic arteritis and 18 miscellaneous causes
The anatomo-clinical appearance is in keeping with the criteria for Buerger's disease with the exception of superficial migratory thrombophlebitis
The absolute basis of treatment has been the total definitive discontinuation of smoking
Platelet anti-aggregant agents have also been used
Aside from limited resections of distal gangrenous regions (168 cases), surgery has been limited to lumbar sympathectomy without adrenalectomy (154 cases)
Out of 133 patients regularly followed up for more than one year, results were good in 102 patients
The 39 poor results occurred exclusively in patients who continued or restarted smoking
